shortlist.name: Magic Box (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Comes in with strong, progressive form including two wins in last three starts, trained by William Haggas (noted for high strike rate at this level), and partnered by a top jockey. Consistency and proven ability at this grade make this runner a standout.

shortlist.name: Radiance
shortlist.rationale: Lightly raced with a win and a close third in two starts, suggesting scope for further improvement. George Boughey is a trainer in form, and Billy Loughnane is a capable young jockey. Market support and unexposed profile are positives.

shortlist.name: Reciprocated
shortlist.odds_note: 9/4 SBK, 3.85 exchange (clear favourite, solid market support)
shortlist.rationale: Strong early season form with two wins, recent runs in higher grade suggest not out of form but possibly found class ceiling. Returns to a more suitable level here. Top connections and reliable jockey. Odds reflect strong chance and market confidence.

shortlist.name: Amorim
shortlist.odds_note: 5/2 SBK, 4.2 exchange (well-supported, second choice in market)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent profile with win and two placings from last four, latest fourth not far off the winner in a competitive field. Trainer in good form, jockey is highly regarded. Profile suggests reliability and scope for further improvement at this level.

shortlist.name: Ipanema Queen (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 11/4 SBK, 3.85 exchange (clear favourite, solid market support)
shortlist.rationale: Strong recent form including a win and a second in last four starts, representing a top Irish yard with a reliable jockey. Consistency at this level and market confidence make her the standout on form and connections.

shortlist.name: Shine On Me
shortlist.odds_note: 9/2 SBK, 5.6 exchange (well-backed, second choice in market)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent placer with a top jockey/trainer combo. Recent form figures show reliability and ability to compete at this level. Market position reflects realistic winning chance.

shortlist.name: Beautiful Diamond
shortlist.odds_note: 5/2 SBK, 3.8 exchange (clear favourite, strong market support)
shortlist.rationale: Proven at this level with a Group 2 win as a juvenile and solid placed efforts in competitive handicaps last season. Returns after a needed reappearance run and is expected to come on for fitness. Top connections and market leader status reinforce confidence.

shortlist.name: Star Of Mehmas (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 7/2 SBK, 4.6 exchange (well-backed, second choice in market)
shortlist.rationale: Ultra-consistent profile with multiple wins and recent form figures showing a win last time out. Handles a range of conditions and is tactically versatile. Retains a progressive profile and is respected on current form and market position.

shortlist.name: Star Of Lady M
shortlist.odds_note: 10/3 SBK, 4.8 exchange (solid third favourite, holding form)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent filly with strong handicap form and a good seasonal reappearance. Proven at the track and trip, and connections are in form. Well-treated on best efforts and should be competitive if building on latest run.

shortlist.name: Eternal Sunshine
shortlist.odds_note: 9/4 SBK, 4.3 exchange (clear favourite, strong market support)
shortlist.rationale: Arrives in peak form with three consecutive wins, suggesting continued improvement and strong current condition. The trainer is in form and the odds reflect market confidence. No signs of regression in recent runs, and connections are reliable.

shortlist.name: Mostar Dreams (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 11/2 SBK, 8.8 exchange (solid second tier in market)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent performer with a recent win and placed efforts. Trained by Jim Goldie, who has a strong hand in the race, and partnered by an experienced jockey. Odds indicate respect from the market and recent form is competitive for this grade.

shortlist.name: Penelope's Sister (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 9/4 SBK, 4.8 exchange (clear favourite, solid market support)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with multiple placings and wins, proven at this level. Reliable jockey and trainer combination. No signs of declining form; maintains competitiveness in similar races. Odds reflect strong market confidence.

shortlist.name: Atmosphere
shortlist.rationale: Recent win and placed efforts indicate solid current form. Connections are capable at this level. Form figures show consistency and ability to compete for top honours. Odds offer reasonable value for a likely contender.

shortlist.name: Keats House (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 9/2 SBK, 5.8 exchange (third in market, not a longshot)
shortlist.rationale: Recent win and string of placed efforts suggest upward trajectory. Trainer/jockey partnership is respected. Form is reliable and indicates readiness for another strong run. Odds are competitive for a horse with winning recent form.

shortlist.name: Dwindling Funds
shortlist.rationale: Comes into the race in peak form with three wins from last four starts, including back-to-back victories. Reliable jockey booking and trainer in form. Odds reflect strong market support and recent consistency.

shortlist.name: Native Honey (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Returned to winning ways last time out, suggesting improvement and readiness. Trainer-jockey combination is proven at Ayr. Odds indicate solid market respect without being overbet.

shortlist.name: Perseus Way (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 7/2 SBK, 5.9 exchange (clear market leader, not an outsider)
shortlist.rationale: Returned to form with a win two starts ago and followed up with a solid fifth in a competitive field. Has proven ability at this level and is partnered by a reliable jockey. Market support suggests strong confidence.

shortlist.name: Alnayef (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with multiple placings, including a close second two starts back. Trainer and jockey combination is respected locally. Profile suggests reliability and competitiveness at this grade.

shortlist.name: Trojan Sun
shortlist.rationale: Recent form includes a win and several respectable efforts in the frame. Remains on a workable mark and represents a yard in form. Odds indicate market respect and realistic winning chance.

shortlist.name: One And Gone (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Strong debut second suggests immediate ability; top jockey booked; stable in good form. Market support is significant and form is reliable for this grade.

shortlist.name: Noble Vow (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent placed efforts in both starts; trainer excels with juveniles at this venue. Form is progressive and odds offer value against the favourite.

shortlist.name: Ghaadah (Fr)
shortlist.odds_note: 15/8 SBK, 3.45 exchange (clear favourite, not a longshot)
shortlist.rationale: Won on debut, indicating strong ability and fitness. Connections are in good form and the market support is significant. Recent winning form is a key positive, and the odds reflect strong confidence from both bookmakers and exchange backers.

shortlist.name: True Test
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with two wins and a fifth, showing reliability and competitiveness. Trainer and jockey are capable, and the odds indicate genuine market respect. Proven ability to win and maintain form over multiple runs.

shortlist.name: Tavana
shortlist.odds_note: 4/1 SBK, 5.9 exchange (solid market position, not a longshot)
shortlist.rationale: Won on debut and ran respectably next time. Still unexposed and open to improvement. Odds are competitive and connections are respected. Recent winning form is a positive indicator for further progress.

shortlist.name: French Affair (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with a win and two placings in last four starts, suggesting reliability and current fitness. Ridden by a capable jockey and trained by a respected yard. Odds indicate strong market support, making this runner a leading contender.

shortlist.name: Shaman Champion (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Has run well in competitive company and is partnered with top jockey William Buick. Recent form includes a win and a second, and current odds reflect market respect. Connections and form suggest a strong chance if running to best.

shortlist.name: Victorious One
shortlist.rationale: Ultra-consistent with three consecutive seconds before a slightly below-par sixth. Trained by Ralph Beckett and ridden by Rossa Ryan, both in good form. Likely to be in the mix again based on consistency and connections.

shortlist.name: Look To The Stars (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Progressive profile with two seconds followed by a win, indicating improvement and reliability. Trained by Charlie Appleby and ridden by William Buick, both highly respected at this level. Short odds reflect strong market confidence and recent form is superior to most rivals.

shortlist.name: Tierra Del Toro
shortlist.rationale: Lightly raced with a win and a second from two starts, showing clear ability and scope for further improvement. Ralph Beckett is a trainer in form and the odds indicate genuine market respect. Recent form figures are strong and suggest readiness to compete for the win.

shortlist.name: Remmooz
shortlist.rationale: Remmooz has highly consistent recent form, winning two of last five and placing in the others, indicating strong current condition. The odds reflect clear market support, and the Burrows yard is reliable at this level. No signs of regression in the profile, and the horse is proven at this class.

shortlist.name: Volterra (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Volterra has a patchy but high-class profile, with a recent win and a respectable third last time out after a break. The horse is lightly raced this season, suggesting potential for further improvement. Market position is strong and connections are capable at this level.

shortlist.name: Spy Chief
shortlist.odds_note: 10/3 (SBK), 4.8 (Exchange) – third in the market, not an outsider
shortlist.rationale: Spy Chief is trained by the Gosdens and ridden by Buick, both top-class connections. Recent form is mixed but includes a win and a second, and the horse has been running in competitive company. Odds suggest the market still respects his chances, and he does not require major improvement to contend.

shortlist.name: Orionis
shortlist.odds_note: 15/8 SBK, 3.05 exchange (clear favourite, strong market support)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with two wins and two places in last five starts, representing a top yard with a reliable jockey. No signs of decline and proven ability at this level. Odds reflect strong chance and connections are in form[1][4].

shortlist.name: El Megeeth (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 5/2 SBK, 4.7 exchange (solid second choice, not a longshot)
shortlist.rationale: Progressive profile with two consecutive runner-up finishes, suggesting readiness to win soon. Jockey and trainer combination is respected, and odds indicate genuine market confidence. No major improvement needed, just consistency[1][4].

shortlist.name: Quebella
shortlist.odds_note: 15/4 SBK, 5.7 exchange (third in market, not an outsider)
shortlist.rationale: Recent win and placed efforts show ability at this level. Slight dip in last two runs but overall profile is competitive. Trainer is capable and odds offer some value for a horse proven in similar company[1][4].

shortlist.name: Vincent Rocks (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 5/2 SBK, 4.0 exchange (clear favourite, strong market support)
shortlist.rationale: Unbeaten in two starts, showing progressive profile and clear ability at this level. Top jockey booked and trainer in good form. No signs of regression and market leader status is justified by recent form and connections.

shortlist.name: Approval
shortlist.odds_note: 11/2 SBK, 7.4 exchange (solid second tier in market)
shortlist.rationale: Has won at this level and retains potential to bounce back after some below-par efforts. Top jockey and trainer combination, and odds offer value if returning to best. Recent form is mixed but not out of contention on peak efforts.

shortlist.name: Shady Bay (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 11/2 SBK, 7.4 exchange (well supported, not an outsider)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent performer with two recent wins and placed efforts. Proven at this level and distance, and connections are reliable. Recent form suggests holding condition and capable of another strong run.

shortlist.name: Duffus Castle
shortlist.odds_note: 5/2 SBK, 3.65 exchange (clear favourite, strong market support)
shortlist.rationale: Returned to form with a win last time out, suggesting peak condition. Has a reliable jockey and trainer combination. Odds reflect strong market confidence and recent improvement, making this runner the most solid on both form and value grounds.

shortlist.name: That Lucas Fella (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 4/1 SBK, 5.8 exchange (well-supported, second choice in market)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent placer at this level, regularly finishing in the frame. Connections are capable and the horse is holding form. Odds are fair for a runner with multiple recent top-four finishes, indicating reliability without needing major improvement.

shortlist.name: Grizzieblanca (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 9/2 SBK, 6 exchange (third in market, not a longshot)
shortlist.rationale: Recent winner, showing clear upward trajectory in form. Trainer is respected and the horse is unexposed compared to others. Odds offer some value for a last-time-out winner stepping up in confidence.

shortlist.name: Quercus Robur
shortlist.rationale: Comes off a win last time out, showing peak form and consistency. Has a strong record at this level and is well supported in the market, indicating stable confidence. Connections are reliable, and recent form suggests readiness to repeat success.

shortlist.name: Queen Roslyn
shortlist.rationale: Recent win two starts back signals improvement and ability at this grade. Trainer Brian Ellison is respected locally, and odds reflect genuine market support. Form is solid, and the horse does not require major improvement to contend.

shortlist.name: Clementines Star
shortlist.rationale: Debuts for a capable stable with a strong jockey booking; market support is notable and connections have a good record with newcomers at this level. No major negatives in a field lacking standout proven form.

shortlist.name: Startled Lady
shortlist.rationale: Consistent profile with placed efforts in three of four starts; form is reliable for this grade and trainer is adept with similar types. Drawn well and should be competitive if repeating best.

shortlist.name: Gwen's Girl
shortlist.rationale: Promising debut second suggests natural improvement; trainer can ready one for the track and this filly has scope to progress. Market respect and positive debut run make her a leading player.

shortlist.name: Great Dream
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with three consecutive 3rd/4th place finishes in competitive company. Top connections: Simon & Ed Crisford are highly reliable at Newcastle, and Jack Mitchell is a proven all-weather jockey. The horse is clear market leader, suggesting strong confidence from the betting public and professionals. No sign of regression in form and should be at peak fitness.

shortlist.name: Thaisa
shortlist.rationale: Returned from a break with a solid 3rd last time, indicating fitness and potential for improvement. Andrew Balding is a respected trainer with a good Newcastle record, and P. J. McDonald is a strong booking for this track. The form is progressive and the odds offer fair value for a likely improver.

shortlist.name: Sassy Glory (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 15/8 SBK, 3.25 exchange (clear favourite, strong market support)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with multiple runner-up finishes and a last-time-out win. Connections are reliable, and the odds reflect strong market confidence. No signs of decline and appears to be peaking at the right time.

shortlist.name: Desert Raider
shortlist.odds_note: 9/2 SBK, 5.6 exchange (solid second choice in market)
shortlist.rationale: Recent form includes a third and second in last three starts, indicating improvement and competitiveness at this level. Odds are fair for a horse with proven ability to place and connections with a history of success.

shortlist.name: Yafaarr (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 15/4 SBK, 5.6 exchange (market respect, not a longshot)
shortlist.rationale: Recent form shows steady progress with a fourth last time out and a top jockey booked. Connections are capable, and the odds suggest genuine market interest. Needs only minor improvement to contend.

shortlist.name: Invitorio (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: Strong market support: 11/4 SBK, 4.8 exchange (clear favourite)
shortlist.rationale: Recent runner-up finish signals return to form after a string of moderate efforts. Ruth Carr’s yard is respected for placing horses well at Newcastle. Sullivan is a reliable jockey for the stable. Odds indicate strong confidence from both bookmakers and exchange backers.

shortlist.name: Bazball (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: Solid value: 13/2 SBK, 8.0 exchange (well-backed, not a longshot)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with a second and third in last two starts, showing improvement and reliability. Connections have a good record with sprinters at Newcastle. McHugh is a capable jockey in northern handicaps. Odds offer each-way value for a horse with proven recent competitiveness.

shortlist.name: Asadjumeirah
shortlist.rationale: Latest win shows readiness and ability to score in this grade. Form is consistent, and Hardie/Brittain combination is reliable at Newcastle. Odds reflect genuine market respect, suggesting further improvement is possible.

shortlist.name: Mister Mojito (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: Strong favourite at 11/8 (2.48 exchange), clear market leader.
shortlist.rationale: Consistent performer with multiple recent wins and places, holding form well. Top connections and current odds reflect strong market confidence. No signs of regression in recent runs.

shortlist.name: Flying Fletcher
shortlist.odds_note: Second choice in market at 7/2 (4.6 exchange).
shortlist.rationale: Trainer in good form and runner is well found in the market. Recent form figures are less inspiring but has been running in competitive races and could improve in this company. Represents value as the main threat to the favourite.

shortlist.name: Yaajooz (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent placer with several recent top-three finishes. Connections are respected and the horse is holding form. Odds are fair for a runner with proven ability at this level.

shortlist.name: Sanbona (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Sanbona arrives in top form, winning two of last three starts and consistently placing. Michael Dods is a respected trainer at Newcastle, and the odds reflect strong market support. The recent form figures indicate reliability and peak condition, with no signs of regression.

shortlist.name: Bibendum
shortlist.rationale: Bibendum won two starts back and ran well last time, showing improvement. Julie Camacho is a capable trainer, and the horse's profile suggests upward momentum. Odds are competitive, indicating market respect and realistic winning chance.

shortlist.name: Catch Him Derry (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with a win and placed efforts in last six starts. Top connections: Dan Skelton is a leading trainer and Harry Skelton is a reliable jockey, both with high strike rates in similar races. Odds indicate strong market confidence and suggest minimal improvement needed for success.

shortlist.name: Art Of Diplomacy
shortlist.rationale: Outstanding recent form, winning last three starts and showing progressive improvement. Connections are solid, and the odds reflect genuine winning chance. No signs of decline; horse is peaking and well suited to current conditions.

shortlist.name: A Pai De Nom
shortlist.rationale: Represents top connections with Dan Skelton and Harry Skelton, both highly reliable at this level. Recent form is solid, with a second and fifth in competitive company, and the market strongly supports chances. No major improvement needed; expected to run to form.

shortlist.name: Maldini Milano (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Paul Nicholls and Harry Cobden are elite connections. Recent form includes a win and a second, indicating consistency and ability at this level. Odds offer reasonable value for a runner with proven form and strong yard support.

shortlist.name: Highland Haven
shortlist.rationale: Proven winning form last season, trained by an in-form yard, and partnered by a reliable jockey. The odds reflect strong market confidence and the horse's profile suggests readiness after a break. No major negatives in the context of this field.

shortlist.name: Joueuse Royale (Fr)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form, including a win last time out, and represents a respected stable. The horse is progressive and has shown the ability to compete at this level. Odds offer fair value relative to form and connections.

shortlist.name: Dickens (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 13/8 SBK, 2.78 exchange (clear favourite, strong market support)
shortlist.rationale: Comes here in excellent form with two wins and a third from last three starts, showing consistency and ability to handle similar company. Market support is strong, and connections are in good order. No sign of regression in recent runs.

shortlist.name: Book Of Secrets (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 2/1 SBK, 3.45 exchange (solid second choice in market)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent placer with multiple recent top-three finishes, indicating reliability and fitness. Odds reflect strong market respect. While not prolific, profile suggests another bold showing is likely.

shortlist.name: Top Guy (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 3/1 SBK, 4.2 exchange (third in market, respected yard)
shortlist.rationale: Lightly raced profile for top connections; form figures suggest potential for improvement. Market keeps him safe, and the Skelton team are adept at readying one after a break. Not as proven as the top two but respected on connections and potential.

shortlist.name: Prince Zaltar (Fr)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent performer at this level with a recent win and solid placed efforts. The Skelton team is highly respected, and Harry Skelton is a top jockey booking. Recent form is reliable and the odds reflect strong market support.

shortlist.name: Mohawk Chief (Usa)
shortlist.rationale: Arrives in peak form with a win last time and a string of consistent placed efforts. Connections are in good order and the horse is proven at this level. Odds indicate strong market confidence.

shortlist.name: Shantou Lucky (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 1/2 SBK, 1.63 exchange (clear favourite, very short odds)
shortlist.rationale: Arrives in peak form with three consecutive wins, indicating strong current condition and reliability. Connections are solid, and the odds reflect market confidence. No signs of decline in recent runs.

shortlist.name: Mcgregors Charge
shortlist.rationale: Consistent performer with multiple placings and a recent win. Form suggests reliability and ability to compete at this level. Odds offer reasonable value for a runner with proven recent form.

shortlist.name: High Court Cave (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Returned from a break with a solid second last time, showing ability to bounce back to form. Has winning form in recent runs and is proven at this level. The market support is significant, and connections are reliable. No major negatives in profile.

shortlist.name: October Hill (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with three placings and a close second last time, indicating readiness to win. Trainer and jockey are both respected, and the horse is holding form well. Represents value as a solid each-way or win contender if favourite underperforms.

shortlist.name: Arcland (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with two solid runs this season, including a close 2nd last time. Trained by Cromwell, who excels with stayers at this venue. No signs of decline and well supported in the market.

shortlist.name: Mic Drop (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Solid handicap form, regularly finishing in the frame. Sean Flanagan is a reliable jockey for this type of contest. Recent runs suggest the horse is holding form and competitive at this level.

shortlist.name: Must Meet Cecil (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 15/4 SBK, 5.2 exchange (third choice, not a longshot)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent placer with multiple top-three finishes in recent starts. Connections have a good record with similar types. Form is reliable and odds offer fair value for a horse likely to be involved.

shortlist.name: Silent Dawn (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with a strong second last time out, indicating readiness. Sean Flanagan is a reliable jockey, and the horse is holding form at the right time. Odds reflect strong market support and realistic winning chance.

shortlist.name: Tir Og (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Comes off a win, suggesting improvement and peak fitness. Recent form figures are progressive, and odds indicate genuine support. Connections are capable at this level.

shortlist.name: Centaq (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Recent form shows steady improvement, with a respectable fourth last time. Trainer is experienced and the odds suggest each-way value in a winnable race.

shortlist.name: Sporting Glance (Fr)
shortlist.rationale: Comes off a win last time out, showing peak form after a consistent campaign. Connections are solid and odds reflect strong market support. No sign of decline in recent runs, making this runner the most reliable on current evidence.

shortlist.name: Penny Perfect (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Progressive profile with a win and a solid fourth in only two starts, representing top connections. Jockey/trainer combination is highly respected and the odds indicate genuine market confidence. No major improvement needed; form is upwardly mobile.

shortlist.name: Our Zebo (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Recent win and consistent placings suggest this runner is holding form well. Has shown ability to bounce back from a poor run and remains competitive at this level. Odds are fair for a horse with proven winning form.

shortlist.name: Mickey Cohen (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 15/4 SBK, 4.0 exchange (solid market support, not a longshot)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with multiple placings, trained by Noel Meade who is reliable at this level, and current odds indicate strong market confidence. Has shown ability to handle similar company and conditions.

shortlist.name: Parkgarve (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Recent runner-up effort signals peak fitness and improvement. Trainer has a good record at Downpatrick, and the odds reflect genuine market respect. Form profile suggests readiness to win.

shortlist.name: Navy Guitar (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 5/1 SBK, 4.2 exchange (competitive price, not a longshot)
shortlist.rationale: Recent win in form cycle and competitive odds indicate market support. Sean Flanagan is a capable jockey, and the horse has shown ability to compete at this level. Connections are respected locally.

shortlist.name: Tango Theatre (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Arrives in peak form with two seconds and a win from last three starts, suggesting strong consistency and improvement. Trained by John McConnell, who is reliable at this venue. Odds indicate solid market confidence and value relative to recent form.

shortlist.name: Betty Dutton (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: Exchange 5, SBK 10/3 (prominent in market, slight drift but still respected)
shortlist.rationale: Ultra-consistent profile with multiple recent placings, including two runner-up finishes. Form suggests knocking on the door for a win. Odds reflect strong market support and she fits the profile of a likely improver in this field.

shortlist.name: Jumping Susie (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: Exchange 4.8, SBK 13/2 (solid market position, not an outsider)
shortlist.rationale: Recent form figures show consistent efforts in competitive races, with a third last time out. Represents the same in-form stable as Tango Theatre. Market support and reliable connections make her a credible contender.

shortlist.name: Minella Jury (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 11/5 SBK, 3.45 exchange (clear favourite, strong market support)
shortlist.rationale: Strong market leader with connections known for producing ready winners in this sphere. No public form but respected due to stable reputation and significant market confidence. Not opposed by any standout proven form rivals.

shortlist.name: Tropical Twist (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Represents a top yard with a strong record in bumpers. Market position suggests ability and readiness. No public form but stable/jockey combination is highly respected at this level.

shortlist.name: Moja Dama (Fr)
shortlist.odds_note: 11/4 SBK, 3.85 exchange (solid third choice, proven placed form)
shortlist.rationale: Only runner with placed bumper form, trained by the leading bumper yard and ridden by the top amateur. Third last time out in a similar contest; open to improvement and connections excel with this profile.

shortlist.name: By The Lake (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Won on debut, then ran in a stronger race; top connections (Lyons/Keane) and strong market support indicate high confidence. Recent form suggests ability and potential for improvement at this level.

shortlist.name: First Approach (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent performer at a higher level, trained by Aidan O'Brien. Recent form is reliable, and the horse has placed in competitive company. Odds reflect strong market respect and connections.

shortlist.name: Killourney Reigns (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Arrives in peak form after back-to-back wins, indicating clear progression. Trainer Murtagh is adept at keeping horses improving. Odds suggest the market expects another bold showing.

shortlist.name: Dancing Saxon (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 11/4 SBK, 4.0 exchange (clear favourite, strong market support)
shortlist.rationale: Represents a top yard with a strong record at Dundalk. Recent form figures are solid for this grade, and the horse is prominent in the market, indicating confidence. Connections are notable and the horse is likely to be fit and ready.

shortlist.name: Nazario (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 4/1 SBK, 3.9 exchange (well-backed, second choice in market)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with multiple placings, suggesting reliability at this level. Jockey booking is positive and odds indicate strong market respect. Should be competitive if repeating recent efforts.

shortlist.name: Coincidental Glory (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 15/4 SBK, 5.5 exchange (solid market position, not an outsider)
shortlist.rationale: Has shown ability with multiple placings and is trained by a yard that does well on the all-weather. Market position suggests respect and recent form is competitive for this grade.

shortlist.name: Imperial Dream (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Recent form is mixed but includes competitive efforts at this level. Connections are solid, and current odds offer reasonable value for a horse proven at the track. No major improvement needed, and profile fits typical winner trends.

shortlist.name: Send Harry (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent placer with multiple recent third-place finishes, indicating reliability and readiness. Form is solid for this grade, and odds reflect genuine winning chance. Connections capable at Dundalk.

shortlist.name: Tofino (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Recent win and placed efforts show upward trajectory. Trainer is respected, and jockey booking is positive. Form suggests horse is peaking at the right time, making Tofino a credible contender.

shortlist.name: Punk Poet (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 5/1 (SBK), 3.85 (Exchange) – solid market support, not an outsider
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with a close second last time, suggesting readiness to win. Trainer Lynam is respected at Dundalk, and the odds indicate strong market confidence. No major improvement needed, just needs to repeat latest effort.

shortlist.name: Sayfa Fad (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 8/1 (SBK), 3.15 (Exchange) – notably strong on exchange, not a longshot
shortlist.rationale: Recent winner (last start) and now with top jockey C. T. Keane booked, indicating intent. The exchange price is much shorter than fixed odds, suggesting significant market support. Form is peaking at the right time.

shortlist.name: Nammos
shortlist.rationale: Consistent performer at this level, holding form well with several solid runs in competitive handicaps. Trainer McGuinness is adept at targeting Dundalk, and the odds reflect strong support. No major improvement required, just needs to hold form.

shortlist.name: Frank Pickle (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form, including a close 2nd last time, and holds the best win chance on current odds. Connections are reliable and the horse is fit and in form, making him the standout on both form and value.

shortlist.name: Ozark Daze
shortlist.rationale: Recent 3rd shows return to form after a string of below-par runs. Has placed at this level and offers value as a likely improver with competitive odds.

shortlist.name: Faro Island
shortlist.rationale: Despite limited recent form, Faro Island is the only runner attracting strong market support, suggesting confidence from connections or inside knowledge. The booking of top jockey W. J. Lee is a positive, and the trainer is capable at this level. The field lacks standout recent winners, so market strength is a key pointer.
shortlist.confidence: Solid – market leader in a weak race, but needs to prove ability on track.

shortlist.name: Explorers Way (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Has shown ability in the past with placed efforts and is holding a prominent position in the exchange market. Recent form is mixed but not hopeless in this context. Jockey B. M. Coen is reliable, and the horse has experience at this level. Represents value if returning to best.
shortlist.confidence: Reasonable – market support and past form make for a credible chance.

shortlist.name: Hasten Slowly (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Trainer John McConnell is respected at Dundalk and the horse has a win in the not-too-distant past. Recent form is below best but not disqualifying in this weak field. Odds indicate some market respect, and the connections are capable of improvement.
shortlist.confidence: Moderate – needs to bounce back but has the right profile for this grade.

shortlist.name: Galician Girl (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 5/1 (SBK), 3.15 (Exchange) – solid market support, not an outsider
shortlist.rationale: Returned to form with a win last time out, suggesting peak fitness and improvement. Trainer in good form and runner has proven ability at this level. Odds reflect strong market confidence and value relative to recent performance.

shortlist.name: Famous Enough (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with a win and several placed efforts in last six starts. Remains competitive at this grade and odds indicate respect from the market. Connections reliable for this type of contest.

shortlist.name: Edward Hamilton (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: Strong favourite at 5/4 (2.3 exchange), clear market leader.
shortlist.rationale: Represents the top yard of Aidan O'Brien and is partnered by a leading jockey. The lack of form figures suggests a debut or lightly raced profile, which is typical for this stable's well-bred types at Dundalk. The market support is significant, indicating strong expectations from connections.

shortlist.name: Ben Lawers
shortlist.odds_note: Second choice in the market at 7/2 (4.8 exchange).
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form in the frame (433) before a below-par latest effort. Trained by a respected yard and ridden by a top jockey. Has experience and should be competitive if returning to best recent form.

shortlist.name: Ellen Jay (Usa)
shortlist.odds_note: Expected to be among the market leaders based on top connections and typical market support for Cox/Prat runners.
shortlist.rationale: Brad Cox is a leading trainer with a high strike rate in stakes and allowance company, and Flavien Prat is an elite jockey. This combination is consistently competitive at this level. Even without published recent form, the connections alone suggest strong readiness and intent.

shortlist.name: Ticker Tape Home (Can)
shortlist.odds_note: Likely to be well found in the market given Casse's record at Presque Isle and Husbands' experience.
shortlist.rationale: Mark Casse is a prolific trainer with a strong record at Presque Isle and in synthetic races. Patrick Husbands is a proven big-race jockey. This team is reliable for consistent performances, and the horse is unlikely to be a longshot given these connections.

shortlist.name: Stormcast (Can)
shortlist.odds_note: Should be prominent in the betting due to Casse's strong barn and Hernandez's local knowledge.
shortlist.rationale: Another Casse runner, Stormcast benefits from a top local jockey in Hernandez. Casse often runs multiple live chances in these events, and Hernandez is adept on the Presque Isle surface. The combination points to a strong showing.

shortlist.name: Milliat (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: Expected to be single-figure odds based on Walsh's reputation and Cheminaud's international experience.
shortlist.rationale: Brendan Walsh is a respected trainer with a good record in North American stakes, and Cheminaud is a high-caliber jockey. Horses from this barn are typically well-prepared for synthetic assignments, making this runner a logical contender.

shortlist.name: Away With Red (Saf)
shortlist.odds_note: Exchange odds 3.05 (clear favourite, not an outsider)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with multiple placings, including two seconds and a third in last four starts. Connections are reliable at this level. Current odds reflect strong market support and suggest the horse is expected to be highly competitive.

shortlist.name: Money Galore (Saf)
shortlist.rationale: Solid, consistent form with three top-four finishes from last four runs. Odds indicate respect in the market. No signs of needing major improvement; should be in the mix based on current level.

shortlist.name: American Matador (Saf)
shortlist.odds_note: Exchange odds 6.2 (within competitive range, not an outsider)
shortlist.rationale: Has been consistently hitting the frame with several placings this season. Trainer is capable at this venue. Odds offer some value for a horse with proven ability to contend at this level.

shortlist.name: Direct Hit (Saf)
shortlist.odds_note: Exchange odds 1.27 (strong favourite, not a longshot)
shortlist.rationale: Outstanding recent form with four consecutive wins, top local jockey, and leading trainer. Connections are highly reliable at Fairview. Odds reflect dominance and current form peak. No signs of regression.

shortlist.name: Japanese Garden (Saf)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with a win last time out and multiple placings prior. Top jockey booking and trainer in good local standing. Current odds reflect strong market confidence and suggest minimal improvement needed for another win.

shortlist.name: Ice Cap (Saf)
shortlist.rationale: Regularly competitive at this level with several recent placings and a win earlier in the season. Jockey and trainer combination is reliable in the region. Form suggests readiness and odds offer reasonable value for a win chance.

shortlist.name: Sports Fan (Saf)
shortlist.rationale: Progressive profile with consistent recent form, including a win and two placings from last three starts. Top local jockey and leading trainer combination. Short odds reflect strong chance and connections.

shortlist.name: Fiery Countess (Saf)
shortlist.rationale: Reliable recent form with a win last time out and multiple placings. Consistent at this level and offers value as the main threat to the favourite. Connections are respected locally.

shortlist.name: Beer With The Boys (Saf)
shortlist.odds_note: Current exchange odds 3.0; clear market leader.
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with multiple placings and a close 2nd and 3rd in last three starts. Reliable trainer and holding form well, suggesting readiness to win in this grade. Odds reflect strong market confidence.

shortlist.name: Strange Magic (Saf)
shortlist.rationale: Recent form includes several competitive finishes and a 3rd last time out. Jockey booking is positive and odds indicate strong support. Connections are in form and runner is holding level.

shortlist.name: Back For More (Saf)
shortlist.odds_note: Current exchange odds 3.9; close in market to top two.
shortlist.rationale: Improved last two starts with a 4th and 2nd, suggesting upward trajectory. Top jockey and trainer combination adds confidence. Market position confirms expectations of a strong run.

shortlist.name: Outback Express (Saf)
shortlist.odds_note: Current exchange odds 2.66, clear market leader.
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with two runner-up finishes suggests the horse is in peak condition and ready to win. The trainer is in good local standing and the jockey is reliable. No signs of declining form, and the odds reflect strong market confidence.

shortlist.name: Bomber Bay (Saf)
shortlist.rationale: Solid recent form with multiple placings, including three thirds and a fourth, indicating consistency and competitiveness at this level. Connections are reputable and the odds offer reasonable value for a horse likely to be in the mix.

shortlist.name: My Best Shot (Saf)
shortlist.odds_note: Exchange odds 1.75 (clear favourite, strong market support)
shortlist.rationale: Outstanding recent form with six consecutive wins before a respectable third last time. Top local jockey and trainer combination. No sign of regression and proven at this level.

shortlist.name: Royal Aussie (Saf)
shortlist.odds_note: Exchange odds 2.6 (second favourite, solid market respect)
shortlist.rationale: Consistently running in strong company, recent second suggests return to form. Top trainer and jockey, and profile fits for a horse likely to be competitive at this level.

shortlist.name: Golden Peace (Saf)
shortlist.odds_note: Exchange odds 5.3 (third choice, clear gap to outsiders)
shortlist.rationale: Three wins from last four starts before a slightly disappointing sixth. Remains progressive and is with leading connections. Still offers value if bouncing back to best.

shortlist.name: Golden Grey (Saf)
shortlist.odds_note: Clear market leader at 2.02, strong support.
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with multiple wins and places, top local jockey, and leading trainer. Has been holding form well and is proven at this level. Odds reflect strong chance and connections are highly reliable.

shortlist.name: New Mexico (Saf)
shortlist.odds_note: Second favorite at 2.32, well found in the market.
shortlist.rationale: Recent win last time out signals return to form. Has shown ability to win in this grade and is well positioned by the market. Connections are solid and the horse is fit and in form.

shortlist.name: French Flame (Saf)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent performer with recent placed effort. Has been running in competitive fields and is holding form. Market support suggests stable confidence. Jockey and trainer are both capable at this venue.
